entry.et: Middle English rasour, from Anglo-French rasur, from raser to raze, shave rase

def.dt: :a keen-edged cutting instrument for shaving or cutting hair
:having a sharp narrow back a razor–backed horse
:any of a family (Solenidae) of marine lamellibranch mollusks having a long narrow thin shell
:coiled wire fitted with sharp razor edges and used as an obstacle or barrier

:a scientific and philosophic rule that entities should not be multiplied unnecessarily which is interpreted as requiring that the simplest of competing theories be preferred to the more complex or that explanations of unknown phenomena be sought first in terms of known quantities
:a razor provided with a guard for the blade to prevent deep cuts in the skin
:a razor with a rigid steel cutting blade hinged to a case that forms a handle when the razor is open for use
